name: Panic-Driven Development with Python
description: Learn to write code that works 60% of the time, every time! Covers basic programming concepts, data structures, and problem-solving with Python.

name: Discrete Mathematics or 'Why Didn't I Major in Business?'
description: Discover exciting theorems that will haunt your dreams for years. Covers logic, sets, relations, functions, combinatorics, and graph theory.

name: Computer Architecture: The Bits and Pieces
description: Learn why your fancy gaming PC still can't handle Chrome with 3 tabs open. Introduction to digital logic, assembly, and computer organization.

name: Web Development: Making Things Pretty When You're Not
description: HTML: Where forgetting one bracket ruins your entire day. Covers HTML, CSS, JavaScript basics, and responsive design.

name: Introduction to Data Science: Excel Sheets on Steroids
description: Learn to nod confidently when someone mentions 'correlation vs. causation'. Covers data analysis, visualization, and basic statistical concepts.

name: Data Structures & Algorithms: The Weeding-Out Process
description: Learn sorting algorithms you'll never implement manually again thanks to libraries. Advanced data structures, algorithm design and analysis.

name: Databases: Where SQL Meets Your First All-Nighter
description: Learn the true meaning of 'foreign key constraint violation' at 3 AM. Relational database design, SQL, and database management.

name: Object-Oriented Programming: Everything Is an Object (Except Happiness)
description: Master inheritance hierarchies so deep they'll give you existential crises. OOP concepts, design patterns, and software architecture.

name: Introduction to AI and Prompting: Teaching Robots to Do Your Homework
description: Learn to craft prompts that produce anything but what you actually want. Fundamentals of AI, LLM concepts, and effective prompt engineering.

name: Operating Systems: Kernel Panic is Not Just a State of Mind
description: Study deadlocks by experiencing them in your own brain. Process management, memory allocation, file systems, and security.

name: Software Engineering: Group Projects from Hell
description: Learn that 'agile' just means 'changing everything every two days'. Project management, requirements, testing, and development methodologies.

name: Full-Stack Web Development: It Works on My Machineâ„¢
description: Master the art of StackOverflow-driven development. Modern frameworks, APIs, authentication, and deployment.

name: Cloud Computing: Your Data Is Somewhere... Probably
description: Learn what 'the cloud' is beyond 'someone else's computer'. Virtualization, containerization, and microservices architecture.

name: Machine Learning: Teaching Computers to Guess Better Than You
description: Create models that are wrong in fascinating and unpredictable ways. Supervised/unsupervised learning, model evaluation, and practical applications.

name: Computer Networks: Why Your Netflix Buffers
description: OSI model: Seven layers of problems you can blame when things go wrong. Network protocols, architecture, security, and distributed systems.

name: Cybersecurity: Paranoia as a Profession
description: Learn why you should never use public Wi-Fi or click on emails from 'princes'. Threat modeling, encryption, ethical hacking, and security protocols.

name: DevOps: Automating Everything Except Your Job Search
description: Master the art of breaking production environments in new and exciting ways. CI/CD pipelines, infrastructure as code, monitoring, and automation.

name: Advanced AI Applications: Ensuring Your Future Robot Overlords Look Upon You Favorably
description: Learn to build AIs that are just smart enough to be useful but not enough to revolt. Computer vision, NLP, reinforcement learning, and ethical considerations.

name: Capstone Project: 'Error: Project Not Found'
description: Create something impressive enough for your portfolio but simple enough to finish. Year-long hands-on project integrating multiple technologies.

name: Emerging Technologies: Next Big Things That May Be Obsolete By Graduation
description: Study cutting-edge tech that will be replaced by something better before you master it. Quantum computing, blockchain, edge computing, and future trends.
